definition:
A phenomenon where a learned
model itself performs optimization, creating a mesa-optimizer distinct from
the base optimizer used for training.

positive_examples: This is an example of mesa optimization.
The mesa optimization demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed mesa optimization in this context.
A typical case of mesa optimization would involve these features.
The concept of mesa optimization applies here.
The process by which learned models develop internal optimization procedures that may pursue different objectives than their training process.
negative_examples: This is an example of non deceptive alignment, not mesa optimization.
This represents a i alignment process in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NonDeceptiveAlignment, or other types of AIAlignmentProcess
